elements.content: As a kind of MOFs, cage-based MOFs usually carry large voids and small windows, which are advantageous to the storage of small molecules that remain kinetically trapped inside the cages (confinement effect). By adjusting the size of windows via reticular synthesis, the cage-based MOFs can selectively capture and separate the suitable size molecules. Here, considering angle-directed and face-directed strategies, a novel multicage-based MOF NUM-3 with a new (3,4,5)-connected topology was successfully constructed in the mixed-ligands assembly. In the framework of NUM-3, there exist four different kinds of cages, which exhibit diverse polyhedral configurations. The four kinds of cages in the order ABCDDCBA as the minimum repeat unit form a 1D tortuous channel along the c axis. Based on the structure characteristics that the 1D channel exhibits different inner diameter (from 4.0 to13.0 Å), NUM-3a (actived NUM-3) can capture CO2 over C2H4 and C2H6 by the size selectivity (the empirical kinetic diameters: CO2 < C2H4 < C2H6). In addition, it also exhibits commendable selectivity for CO2 over N2 and CH4.
elements.clean_text: As a kind of MOFs, cage-based MOFs usually carry large voids and small windows, which are advantageous to the storage of small molecules that remain kinetically trapped inside the cages (confinement effect). By adjusting the size of windows via reticular synthesis, the cage-based MOFs can selectively capture and separate the suitable size molecules. Here, considering angle-directed and face-directed strategies, a novel multicage-based MOF NUM-3 with a new (3,4,5)-connected topology was successfully constructed in the mixed-ligands assembly. In the framework of NUM-3, there exist four different kinds of cages, which exhibit diverse polyhedral configurations. The four kinds of cages in the order ABCDDCBA as the minimum repeat unit form a 1D tortuous channel along the c axis. Based on the structure characteristics that the 1D channel exhibits different inner diameter (from 4.0 to13.0 Å), NUM-3a (actived NUM-3) can capture CO2 over C2H4 and C2H6 by the size selectivity (the empirical kinetic diameters: CO2 < C2H4 < C2H6). In addition, it also exhibits commendable selectivity for CO2 over N2 and CH4.

elements.content: Metal–organic frameworks (MOFs), or porous coordination polymers (PCPs) as an emerging crystalline materials, are constructed from metal ions (or metal clusters) as nodes and organic ligands as linkers, which exhibit widespread applications in numerous areas such as catalysis, gas storage and separation, drug delivery, and optical/electric/magnetic fields. As a special type, cage-based MOFs, in contrast to the conventional straight-channel porous MOFs, hold large ordered cavities and small windows, which are advantageous to storage of specific size molecules remaining kinetically trapped inside the cages (confinement effect). In addition, by adjusting the size of windows via reticular synthesis, the cage-based MOFs can selectively capture and separate the suitable size molecules. Based on these characteristics, the construction of desirable cage-based MOFs is of significance. However, it is still a challenge to synthesize the targeted cage-based MOFs with specific pores and apertures.
elements.clean_text:
Introduction

Metal-organic frameworks (MOFs), or porous coordination polymers (PCPs) as an emerging crystalline materials, are constructed from metal ions (or metal clusters) as nodes and organic ligands as linkers, which exhibit widespread applications in numerous areas such as catalysis, gas storage and separation, drug delivery, and optical/electric/magnetic fields. As a special type, cage-based MOFs, in contrast to the conventional straight-channel porous MOFs, hold large ordered cavities and small windows, which are advantageous to storage of specific size molecules remaining kinetically trapped inside the cages (confinement effect). In addition, by adjusting the size of windows via reticular synthesis, the cage-based MOFs can selectively capture and separate the suitable size molecules. Based on these characteristics, the construction of desirable cage-based MOFs is of significance. However, it is still a challenge to synthesize the targeted cage-based MOFs with specific pores and apertures.

elements.content: It has been demonstrated that the selection of suitable organic ligands is important to the construction of the cage-based MOFs. Recent investigations have corroborated that, considering the angle-directed self-assembly strategy, the bend angle θ of the ligands is the most important parameter that controls the formation of cages. Usually, isolated polyhedral cages can be assembled with bend angle θ of the ligands in the ranges of 134–149° or 0–120°; therefore, the ligands with isophthalic acid subunits (angle between carboxyl group θ = 120°) are typical ones for the fabrication of cage-based MOFs. Typical cases include MFM-130, MFM-131, NOTT-112, and NOTT-116, which are derived from the assembly of corresponding metal ions and functionalized multicarboxylic acid ligands bearing isophthalic acid moieties. Besides the angle-directed self-assembly strategy, some C 3-symmetric facial ligands are also suitable to build cage-based MOFs (face-directed assembly), which is well reflected by cage-based MOFs supported by N-donor ligands with C 3-symmetric configuration (for example tpt = 2,4,6-tri­(4-pyridinyl)-1,3,5-triazine, H3btt = 1,3,5-tris­(tetrazol-5-yl)­benzene). So, based on the angle-directed and face-directed strategies, selecting the fitted ligands is an important factor to construct the cage-based MOFs, for example selecting a single kind of ligand (the ligand with bend angle subunit or ligand with C 3-symmetric configuration) or mixed-ligands (one with bend angle subunit and one with C 3-symmetric configuration) could be easier to construct the cage-based MOFs.
elements.clean_text: It has been demonstrated that the selection of suitable organic ligands is important to the construction of the cage-based MOFs. Recent investigations have corroborated that, considering the angle-directed self-assembly strategy, the bend angle θ of the ligands is the most important parameter that controls the formation of cages. Usually, isolated polyhedral cages can be assembled with bend angle θ of the ligands in the ranges of 134-149° or 0-120°; therefore, the ligands with isophthalic acid subunits (angle between carboxyl group θ = 120°) are typical ones for the fabrication of cage-based MOFs. Typical cases include MFM-130, MFM-131, NOTT-112, and NOTT-116, which are derived from the assembly of corresponding metal ions and functionalized multicarboxylic acid ligands bearing isophthalic acid moieties. Besides the angle-directed self-assembly strategy, some C 3-symmetric facial ligands are also suitable to build cage-based MOFs (face-directed assembly), which is well reflected by cage-based MOFs supported by N-donor ligands with C 3-symmetric configuration (for example tpt = 2,4,6-tri(4-pyridinyl)-1,3,5-triazine, H3btt = 1,3,5-tris(tetrazol-5-yl)benzene). So, based on the angle-directed and face-directed strategies, selecting the fitted ligands is an important factor to construct the cage-based MOFs, for example selecting a single kind of ligand (the ligand with bend angle subunit or ligand with C 3-symmetric configuration) or mixed-ligands (one with bend angle subunit and one with C 3-symmetric configuration) could be easier to construct the cage-based MOFs.

elements.content: We have sought to explore the synthetic methodology toward the construction of cage-based MOFs. Considering the characteristics of two types of ligands aforementioned, our group employed a mixed-ligands strategy (tpt as the main ligand and distinct carboxylic acids ligands as the auxiliary ligand) to construct cage-based MOFs in which the dicarboxylic acid ligand or tricarboxylic acid ligands have been preferred as the auxiliary ligand. For example, double-walled and three-walled cage-based porous MOFs were constructed by tpt and a flexible tricarboxylic acid ligand. However, the tetracarboxylic acid ligand has more coordination modes, which could be advantageous to construct special multicage-based MOF mixed with tpt ligand. Herein, we select a tetracarboxylic acid (3,3′,5,5′-azobenzenetetracarboxylic acid) ligand containing isophthalic acid groups, which was mixed with tpt constructing a multicage-based Ni-MOF {[Ni3(abtc)1.5(tpt)­(H2O)5(DMF)]·(DMF)3·(H2O)6}n (NUM-3) (H4abtc = 3,3′,5,5′-azobenzenetetracarboxylic acid, tpt= 2,4,6-tri­(4-pyridinyl)-1,3,5-triazine). For the two ligands, they both can serve as the surfaces (quadrangle and triangle) and the edges of a polyhedral cage. Based on the features of ligands, there contains four different kinds of cages in NUM-3 framework which exhibit large free void with different inner diameters and windows sizes. Along the c axis, the four kinds of cages are arranged in the ABCDCBA rule as the minimum repeat unit to form a tortuous channel (), and the framework of NUM-3 shows a new topology. It is very gratifying to see, based on the structure characteristics, that NUM-3a (activated NUM-3) reveals comparatively high adsorption capacity and selectivity for CO2.
elements.clean_text: We have sought to explore the synthetic methodology toward the construction of cage-based MOFs. Considering the characteristics of two types of ligands aforementioned, our group employed a mixed-ligands strategy (tpt as the main ligand and distinct carboxylic acids ligands as the auxiliary ligand) to construct cage-based MOFs in which the dicarboxylic acid ligand or tricarboxylic acid ligands have been preferred as the auxiliary ligand. For example, double-walled and three-walled cage-based porous MOFs were constructed by tpt and a flexible tricarboxylic acid ligand. However, the tetracarboxylic acid ligand has more coordination modes, which could be advantageous to construct special multicage-based MOF mixed with tpt ligand. Herein, we select a tetracarboxylic acid (3,3',5,5'-azobenzenetetracarboxylic acid) ligand containing isophthalic acid groups, which was mixed with tpt constructing a multicage-based Ni-MOF {[Ni3(abtc)1.5(tpt)(H2O)5(DMF)]⋅(DMF)3⋅(H2O)6}n (NUM-3) (H4abtc = 3,3',5,5'-azobenzenetetracarboxylic acid, tpt= 2,4,6-tri(4-pyridinyl)-1,3,5-triazine). For the two ligands, they both can serve as the surfaces (quadrangle and triangle) and the edges of a polyhedral cage. Based on the features of ligands, there contains four different kinds of cages in NUM-3 framework which exhibit large free void with different inner diameters and windows sizes. Along the c axis, the four kinds of cages are arranged in the ABCDCBA rule as the minimum repeat unit to form a tortuous channel (), and the framework of NUM-3 shows a new topology. It is very gratifying to see, based on the structure characteristics, that NUM-3a (activated NUM-3) reveals comparatively high adsorption capacity and selectivity for CO2.

elements.content: (a) Structures of cages A, B, C, and D; (b) viewed along the c axis showing the 1D tortuous channels formed with four kinds of cages arranging in ABCDCBA rule; (c) the three-dimensional framework of NUM-3 and the diagrammatic sketch of framework.
elements.clean_text: 1  (a) Structures of cages A, B, C, and D; (b) viewed along the c axis showing the 1D tortuous channels formed with four kinds of cages arranging in ABCDCBA rule; (c) the three-dimensional framework of NUM-3 and the diagrammatic sketch of framework.

elements.content: The ligands 2,4,6-tri­(4-pyridinyl)-1,3,5-triazine (tpt) and 3,3′,5,5′-azobenzenetetracarboxylic acid (H4abtc) were synthesized according to the literature procedure, and other reagents were obtained from commercial suppliers and used without further purification. Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) was carried out on a Rigaku standard TG-DTA analyzer between room temperature and 700 °C under air atmosphere with a heating rate of 10 °C min–1, using an empty Pt crucible as reference. Elemental analysis (C, H, and N) was performed on a vario EL cube elemental analyzer. IR spectra were measured in the range of 400–4000 cm–1 on a Tensor 27 OPUS FT-IR spectrometer (Bruker, German) using KBr pellets. Powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) was measured on a Rigaku Miniflex 600.
elements.clean_text:
Experimental Section

Materials and Methods

The ligands 2,4,6-tri(4-pyridinyl)-1,3,5-triazine (tpt) and 3,3',5,5'-azobenzenetetracarboxylic acid (H4abtc) were synthesized according to the literature procedure, and other reagents were obtained from commercial suppliers and used without further purification. Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) was carried out on a Rigaku standard TG-DTA analyzer between room temperature and 700 °C under air atmosphere with a heating rate of 10 °C min-1, using an empty Pt crucible as reference. Elemental analysis (C, H, and N) was performed on a vario EL cube elemental analyzer. IR spectra were measured in the range of 400-4000 cm-1 on a Tensor 27 OPUS FT-IR spectrometer (Bruker, German) using KBr pellets. Powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) was measured on a Rigaku Miniflex 600.

elements.content: Gas adsorption/desorption measurements were carried out using a Micrometrics ASAP 2020 M volumetric gas adsorption analyzer. UHP-grade gases were used in measurements. Before the measurement, the sample of NUM-3 was soaked in anhydrous methanol (CH3OH) for 3 days to remove DMF and H2O solvent molecules in the channels and then filtrated, and activation of the methanol-exchanged NUM-3 at 100 °C under high vacuum (less than 10–5 Torr) overnight led to the formation of activated sample NUM-3a. About 142 mg of the desolvated sample was used for the entire sorption measurements. The N2 sorption isotherm measurements were proceeded at 77 K in a liquid-nitrogen bath. The CO2, CH4, C2H4, C2H6, and N2 sorption isotherm measurements were carried out at 273 and 298 K, respectively.
elements.clean_text:
Gas Sorption Measurements

Gas adsorption/desorption measurements were carried out using a Micrometrics ASAP 2020 M volumetric gas adsorption analyzer. UHP-grade gases were used in measurements. Before the measurement, the sample of NUM-3 was soaked in anhydrous methanol (CH3OH) for 3 days to remove DMF and H2O solvent molecules in the channels and then filtrated, and activation of the methanol-exchanged NUM-3 at 100 °C under high vacuum (less than 10-5 Torr) overnight led to the formation of activated sample NUM-3a. About 142 mg of the desolvated sample was used for the entire sorption measurements. The N2 sorption isotherm measurements were proceeded at 77 K in a liquid-nitrogen bath. The CO2, CH4, C2H4, C2H6, and N2 sorption isotherm measurements were carried out at 273 and 298 K, respectively.

elements.content: A mixture of Ni­(NO3)2·6H2O (291 mg, 0.1 mmol), tpt (156 mg, 0.05 mmol), and H4abtc (179 mg, 0.05 mmol) was dispersed into 16 mL of mixed solvent (DMF/C2H5OH/H2O, 6/1/1, v/v/v) in a screw-capped glass vial (20 mL). After the mixture was stirred for 10 min, the vial was sealed and placed in a 95 °C oven for 3 days. The kelly block crystals were obtained after cooling to room temperature. The yield was about 80% based on the metal. IR spectrum (cm–1): 3412m, 1660s, 1559w, 1518m, 1434w, 1376s, 1244w, 1097m, 1060w, 807m, 780m, 718m, 655m, 513m. Elem anal. Calcd for NUM-3 (C54H71N13Ni3O27): C, 42.91; H, 4.70; N, 12.05. Found: C, 42.82; H, 4.65; N, 12.20.
elements.clean_text:
Synthese of NUM-3 

A mixture of Ni(NO3)2⋅6H2O (291 mg, 0.1 mmol), tpt (156 mg, 0.05 mmol), and H4abtc (179 mg, 0.05 mmol) was dispersed into 16 mL of mixed solvent (DMF/C2H5OH/H2O, 6/1/1, v/v/v) in a screw-capped glass vial (20 mL). After the mixture was stirred for 10 min, the vial was sealed and placed in a 95 °C oven for 3 days. The kelly block crystals were obtained after cooling to room temperature. The yield was about 80% based on the metal. IR spectrum (cm-1): 3412m, 1660s, 1559w, 1518m, 1434w, 1376s, 1244w, 1097m, 1060w, 807m, 780m, 718m, 655m, 513m. Elem anal. Calcd for NUM-3 (C54H71N13Ni3O27): C, 42.91; H, 4.70; N, 12.05. Found: C, 42.82; H, 4.65; N, 12.20.

elements.content: The diffraction data was collected on a Rigaku 007HF XtaLAB P200 diffractometer at 113 K with Mo Kα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å) by scan mode. The structure was solved by direct methods using SHELXTL and refined by full-matrix least-squares on F2 using SHELXL. Metal atoms in NUM-3 were located from the E-maps, and other non-hydrogen atoms were subsequently located in successive difference Fourier synthesis and refined anisotropically. The H atoms of the coordinated water molecules in NUM-3 cannot be added in the calculated positions, and they were directly included in the final molecular formula. The guest molecules in NUM-3 are disordered and could not be modeled properly, so the disordered solvent molecules are removed by SQUEEZE in PLATON, and the results were appended in the CIF file. Detailed crystallographic data are summarized in , and the selected bond lengths and angles are given in . Full crystallographic data for NUM-3 have been deposited with the CCDC (1504309). The data can be obtained free of charge from the Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre via www.ccdc.cam.ac.uk/data_request/cif.
elements.clean_text:
Crystal Structure Determination

The diffraction data was collected on a Rigaku 007HF XtaLAB P200 diffractometer at 113 K with Mo Kα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å) by scan mode. The structure was solved by direct methods using SHELXTL and refined by full-matrix least-squares on F2 using SHELXL. Metal atoms in NUM-3 were located from the E-maps, and other non-hydrogen atoms were subsequently located in successive difference Fourier synthesis and refined anisotropically. The H atoms of the coordinated water molecules in NUM-3 cannot be added in the calculated positions, and they were directly included in the final molecular formula. The guest molecules in NUM-3 are disordered and could not be modeled properly, so the disordered solvent molecules are removed by SQUEEZE in PLATON, and the results were appended in the CIF file. Detailed crystallographic data are summarized in , and the selected bond lengths and angles are given in . Full crystallographic data for NUM-3 have been deposited with the CCDC (1504309). The data can be obtained free of charge from the Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre via www.ccdc.cam.ac.uk/data_request/cif.

elements.content: X-ray crystallographic analysis reveals that NUM-3 crystallizes in the trigonal space group R-3, and its asymmetric unit consists of three Ni­(II) ions, one-half of abtc4– ligands, one tpt ligand, five coordinated water molecules, and one coordinated DMF molecule. The three crystallographically independent Ni­(II) ions all adopt six-coordinated model lying at the center of octahedral geometry, but as shown in Figure S1, , and they form two kinds of secondary building unit (SBU; Ni1 is mononuclear SBU and Ni2 and Ni3 form a binuclear SBU). By the abtc4– ligands, the two kinds of SBU can be linked into two-dimension layers (Figure S2, ), which are further bridged by tpt ligands generating a three-dimension (3D) extended open framework with 1D channels (c). As shown in a,b, the 1D channel is constructed by four kinds of cages in ABCDCBA arrangement, and the minimum repeat unit is composed of seven cages which is the reason that c axis can reach 95.1715 Å.
elements.clean_text:
Results and Discussion

Single-Crystal X-ray Structures

X-ray crystallographic analysis reveals that NUM-3 crystallizes in the trigonal space group R-3, and its asymmetric unit consists of three Ni(II) ions, one-half of abtc4- ligands, one tpt ligand, five coordinated water molecules, and one coordinated DMF molecule. The three crystallographically independent Ni(II) ions all adopt six-coordinated model lying at the center of octahedral geometry, but as shown in Figure S1, , and they form two kinds of secondary building unit (SBU; Ni1 is mononuclear SBU and Ni2 and Ni3 form a binuclear SBU). By the abtc4- ligands, the two kinds of SBU can be linked into two-dimension layers (Figure S2, ), which are further bridged by tpt ligands generating a three-dimension (3D) extended open framework with 1D channels (c). As shown in a,b, the 1D channel is constructed by four kinds of cages in ABCDCBA arrangement, and the minimum repeat unit is composed of seven cages which is the reason that c axis can reach 95.1715 Å.

elements.content: The symmetrical cages A, B, and C have identical structure, but they locate at different angles in the channel. For cage A, it was constructed by six mononuclear SBUs and seven binuclear SBUs, in which 12 metal-SBUs as vertices form a tetrakaidecahedron (). Because the abtc4– ligand represents a quadrangular plane and the angle of adjacent pyridine ring from tpt is 120°, in the irregular tetrakaidecahedron the abtc4– ligands mainly functioned as polyhedral faces, and the partial tpt ligands and one isophthalic acid subunit of abtc4– ligand are regarded as edges. Cages B, C, and D are all in octahedral geometry, but there are some differences (). Cages B and C are semienclosed octahedral frameworks, while cage D is an open octahedral framework. With construction of polyhedral cage B, the whole tpt ligands are viewed as faces, and the partial tpt ligands and partial abtc4– ligands (angle θ = 60° between two carboxyl groups belonging to two benzene ring) are located in edges. For cage C, the isophthalic acid subunits of abtc4– ligands and tpt serve as edges and surfaces, respectively. Polyhedral cage D is fully constituted by isophthalic acid subunits of abtc4– ligands, exhibiting an edge-transitive octahedral geometry.
elements.clean_text: The symmetrical cages A, B, and C have identical structure, but they locate at different angles in the channel. For cage A, it was constructed by six mononuclear SBUs and seven binuclear SBUs, in which 12 metal-SBUs as vertices form a tetrakaidecahedron (). Because the abtc4- ligand represents a quadrangular plane and the angle of adjacent pyridine ring from tpt is 120°, in the irregular tetrakaidecahedron the abtc4- ligands mainly functioned as polyhedral faces, and the partial tpt ligands and one isophthalic acid subunit of abtc4- ligand are regarded as edges. Cages B, C, and D are all in octahedral geometry, but there are some differences (). Cages B and C are semienclosed octahedral frameworks, while cage D is an open octahedral framework. With construction of polyhedral cage B, the whole tpt ligands are viewed as faces, and the partial tpt ligands and partial abtc4- ligands (angle θ = 60° between two carboxyl groups belonging to two benzene ring) are located in edges. For cage C, the isophthalic acid subunits of abtc4- ligands and tpt serve as edges and surfaces, respectively. Polyhedral cage D is fully constituted by isophthalic acid subunits of abtc4- ligands, exhibiting an edge-transitive octahedral geometry.

elements.content: Depending on the chosen vertices, cage A can be regarded as a tetrakaidecahedron, and cages B, C, and D can be regarded as octahedrons.
elements.clean_text: 2  Depending on the chosen vertices, cage A can be regarded as a tetrakaidecahedron, and cages B, C, and D can be regarded as octahedrons.

elements.content: According to structural analysis, it further exhibits that, based on organic ligands, using flexibly angle-directed and face-directed self-assembly strategy is easy to form cage-based frameworks. The four kinds of cages also reveal a different void space, for which the large free voids with inner diameter (getting rid of the van der Waals radius) are ∼13.0 Å for cage A, ∼10.0 Å for cage B, ∼7.0 Å for cage C, and ∼4.0 Å for cage D, respectively. PLATON analysis showed that the effective free volume of NUM-3 is 56.6% of the crystal volume (23355.2 Å3 out of the 41249.3 Å3 unit cell volume) without free solvent molecules. Based on these characteristics of the cages, along the c axis, 1D tortuous channels can be viewed (Figure S3, ), in which the most narrow place could control the type of the molecules captured into channels. The structural features are conducive to interact with the suitable gas molecules revealing selective adsorption capacity. In addition, the topological analysis was carried out to obtain insight into the structure of NUM-3. The mononuclear SBU and binuclear SBU could be regarded as 4- and 5-connected nodes, and ligands abtc4– and tpt could be simplified as 4- and 3-connected nodes, respectively. Particularly, as shown in Figure S4, , the ligands abtc4– exhibit two kinds of 4-connected models. Thus, the 3D framework of NUM-3 can be viewed as a (3,4,5)-connected topology with Point (Schlafli) symbol {63}2{64·82}5{66·84}2, importantly, which is a new topology (Figure S4, ).
elements.clean_text: According to structural analysis, it further exhibits that, based on organic ligands, using flexibly angle-directed and face-directed self-assembly strategy is easy to form cage-based frameworks. The four kinds of cages also reveal a different void space, for which the large free voids with inner diameter (getting rid of the van der Waals radius) are ~13.0 Å for cage A, ~10.0 Å for cage B, ~7.0 Å for cage C, and ~4.0 Å for cage D, respectively. PLATON analysis showed that the effective free volume of NUM-3 is 56.6% of the crystal volume (23355.2 Å3 out of the 41249.3 Å3 unit cell volume) without free solvent molecules. Based on these characteristics of the cages, along the c axis, 1D tortuous channels can be viewed (Figure S3, ), in which the most narrow place could control the type of the molecules captured into channels. The structural features are conducive to interact with the suitable gas molecules revealing selective adsorption capacity. In addition, the topological analysis was carried out to obtain insight into the structure of NUM-3. The mononuclear SBU and binuclear SBU could be regarded as 4- and 5-connected nodes, and ligands abtc4- and tpt could be simplified as 4- and 3-connected nodes, respectively. Particularly, as shown in Figure S4, , the ligands abtc4- exhibit two kinds of 4-connected models. Thus, the 3D framework of NUM-3 can be viewed as a (3,4,5)-connected topology with Point (Schlafli) symbol {63}2{64⋅82}5{66⋅84}2, importantly, which is a new topology (Figure S4, ).

elements.content: The solvent stability (immersing in a different solvent for more than 3 days) and thermal stability of NUM-3 were demonstrated by PXRD (Figure S5, ) and thermogravimetric (TG) analyses (Figure S8, ). As shown in Figure S5, , NUM-3 exhibits good stability in common solvents, for example, C2H5OH, CH3OH, CH3COCH3, CH2Cl2, and CH3CN, and they still retain a crystalline state under optical microscope (Figure S9, ). The TG curve shows that the thermally stability can reach about 300 °C. Some uncoordinated guest molecules were confirmed by elemental analysis and TGA.
elements.clean_text:
Stabilities of NUM-3 

The solvent stability (immersing in a different solvent for more than 3 days) and thermal stability of NUM-3 were demonstrated by PXRD (Figure S5, ) and thermogravimetric (TG) analyses (Figure S8, ). As shown in Figure S5, , NUM-3 exhibits good stability in common solvents, for example, C2H5OH, CH3OH, CH3COCH3, CH2Cl2, and CH3CN, and they still retain a crystalline state under optical microscope (Figure S9, ). The TG curve shows that the thermally stability can reach about 300 °C. Some uncoordinated guest molecules were confirmed by elemental analysis and TGA.

elements.content: To assess the permanent porosity of NUM-3a (activated NUM-3), the N2 adsorption at 77 K was measured, and a fully reversible type I isotherm obtained exhibits a very sharp uptake at P/P 0 < 0.05, which clearly indicated the microporous character (Figure S10, ). The saturation uptake of NUM-3a for nitrogen physisorption is 531.2 cm3/g, and the pore volume is 0.82 cm3/g. According to the N2 adsorption data, the apparent Brunauer–Emmett–Teller (BET) and Langmuir surface areas are 2111.2 and 2307.2 m2/g, respectively, which are located at the middle position among MOFs materials (). The BET surface area of NUM-3a is higher than many reported MOFs, such as MOF-505 (1547 m2/g), Mg-MOF-74 (1495 m2/g), CoMOF-74 (1080 m2/g), and SIFSIX-2-Cu-i (735 m2/g).
elements.clean_text:
Gas Sorption Properties of NUM-3a 

To assess the permanent porosity of NUM-3a (activated NUM-3), the N2 adsorption at 77 K was measured, and a fully reversible type I isotherm obtained exhibits a very sharp uptake at P/P 0 < 0.05, which clearly indicated the microporous character (Figure S10, ). The saturation uptake of NUM-3a for nitrogen physisorption is 531.2 cm3/g, and the pore volume is 0.82 cm3/g. According to the N2 adsorption data, the apparent Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) and Langmuir surface areas are 2111.2 and 2307.2 m2/g, respectively, which are located at the middle position among MOFs materials (). The BET surface area of NUM-3a is higher than many reported MOFs, such as MOF-505 (1547 m2/g), Mg-MOF-74 (1495 m2/g), CoMOF-74 (1080 m2/g), and SIFSIX-2-Cu-i (735 m2/g).

elements.content: Due to its comparatively high surface areas and void volumes and in order to understand the unique pore structure of NUM-3a, the low-pressure sorption isotherms of the pure-components of CO2, CH4, C2H4, C2H6, and N2 were collected at 273 and 298 K, respectively. As shown in a, NUM-3a shows a comparatively high adsorption amount of CO2, in which the largest adsorption amount can reach 113 cm3(STP)/g at 273 K and 1 atm. However, compared with CO2, the uptake amounts of CH4, C2H4, C2H6, and N2 are only 39, 41, 27, and 10 cm3(STP)/g, respectively, which are clearly less than the adsorption amount of CO2. As well as at 273 K, at an ambient temperature of 298 K, NUM-3a exhibits a similar adsorption trend (83 cm3 (STP)/g for CO2, 25 cm3(STP)/g for CH4, 34 cm3(STP)/g for C2H4, 24 cm3(STP)/g for C2H6, and 5 cm3(STP)/g for N2; b). As shown in , the adsorption amount of NUM-3a for CO2 is not the highest, but which is still higher than a lot of well-known MOFs, such as MFM-130 (109 cm3/g at 273 K and 59 cm3/g at 298 K), MAF-23 (74.2 cm3/g at 273 K and 56.1 cm3/g at 298 K), ZIF-69 (70 cm3/g at 273 K), Zn­(ain)2·(DMF) (66.4 cm3/g at 273 K and 51.3 cm3/g at 298 K), and BIF-41 (77.0 cm3/g at 273 K and 63.5 cm3/g at 294 K).
elements.clean_text: Due to its comparatively high surface areas and void volumes and in order to understand the unique pore structure of NUM-3a, the low-pressure sorption isotherms of the pure-components of CO2, CH4, C2H4, C2H6, and N2 were collected at 273 and 298 K, respectively. As shown in a, NUM-3a shows a comparatively high adsorption amount of CO2, in which the largest adsorption amount can reach 113 cm3(STP)/g at 273 K and 1 atm. However, compared with CO2, the uptake amounts of CH4, C2H4, C2H6, and N2 are only 39, 41, 27, and 10 cm3(STP)/g, respectively, which are clearly less than the adsorption amount of CO2. As well as at 273 K, at an ambient temperature of 298 K, NUM-3a exhibits a similar adsorption trend (83 cm3 (STP)/g for CO2, 25 cm3(STP)/g for CH4, 34 cm3(STP)/g for C2H4, 24 cm3(STP)/g for C2H6, and 5 cm3(STP)/g for N2; b). As shown in , the adsorption amount of NUM-3a for CO2 is not the highest, but which is still higher than a lot of well-known MOFs, such as MFM-130 (109 cm3/g at 273 K and 59 cm3/g at 298 K), MAF-23 (74.2 cm3/g at 273 K and 56.1 cm3/g at 298 K), ZIF-69 (70 cm3/g at 273 K), Zn(ain)2⋅(DMF) (66.4 cm3/g at 273 K and 51.3 cm3/g at 298 K), and BIF-41 (77.0 cm3/g at 273 K and 63.5 cm3/g at 294 K).

elements.content: CO2, CH4, C2H4, C2H6 , and N2 adsorption isotherms of NUM-3a at 273 (a) and 298 K (b); IAST adsorption selectivity of NUM-3a for CO2/N2 and CO2/CH4 at 273 (c) and 298 K (d).
elements.clean_text: 3  CO2, CH4, C2H4, C2H6 , and N2 adsorption isotherms of NUM-3a at 273 (a) and 298 K (b); IAST adsorption selectivity of NUM-3a for CO2/N2 and CO2/CH4 at 273 (c) and 298 K (d).

elements.content: NUM-3a shows a higher adsorption amount for CO2, which is 2.7 and 4.0 times as much as those for C2H4 and C2H6 at 273 K, respectively (at 298 K which is 2.4 times of that C2H4 and 3.3 times of that C2H6). In addition, the ideal adsorbed solution theory (IAST) calculation was employed to evaluate the adsorption selectivity for the following binary gas mixtures: CO2/N2 (15/85), CO2/CH4 (50/50), and CO2/CH4 (5/95). The Langmuir–Freundlich equation fits extremely well with the single-component isotherms of CO2, CH4, and N2 at 273 and 298 K (Figure S11, ), and the fitting parameters are listed in Table S6, . As shown in c,d, the calculated CO2/CH4 selectivities of NUM-3a are 13.7 (5/95) and 11.0 (50/50) at 273 K and 8.9 (5/95) and 8.3­(50/50) at 298 K, which are higher than many famously reported MOFs under 273 K and mixing ratio 50/50, such as HKUST-1 (7.1), MIL-53­(Al) (2.3), ZIF-95 (4.3), and ZIF-100 (5.9). For separation of CO2/N2 (15/85), the values of the selectivity are 82.8 at 273 K and 64.8 at 298 K for NUM-3a, respectively, which could be comparable to the selectivity of LIFM-11 (68.9 at 298 K) and is obviously higher than UTSA-72 (35.6), PCN-88 (15.2), and BUT-11 (31.5) at 298 K. Furthermore, other comparisons of selectivity are list in Table S5, .
elements.clean_text: NUM-3a shows a higher adsorption amount for CO2, which is 2.7 and 4.0 times as much as those for C2H4 and C2H6 at 273 K, respectively (at 298 K which is 2.4 times of that C2H4 and 3.3 times of that C2H6). In addition, the ideal adsorbed solution theory (IAST) calculation was employed to evaluate the adsorption selectivity for the following binary gas mixtures: CO2/N2 (15/85), CO2/CH4 (50/50), and CO2/CH4 (5/95). The Langmuir-Freundlich equation fits extremely well with the single-component isotherms of CO2, CH4, and N2 at 273 and 298 K (Figure S11, ), and the fitting parameters are listed in Table S6, . As shown in c,d, the calculated CO2/CH4 selectivities of NUM-3a are 13.7 (5/95) and 11.0 (50/50) at 273 K and 8.9 (5/95) and 8.3(50/50) at 298 K, which are higher than many famously reported MOFs under 273 K and mixing ratio 50/50, such as HKUST-1 (7.1), MIL-53(Al) (2.3), ZIF-95 (4.3), and ZIF-100 (5.9). For separation of CO2/N2 (15/85), the values of the selectivity are 82.8 at 273 K and 64.8 at 298 K for NUM-3a, respectively, which could be comparable to the selectivity of LIFM-11 (68.9 at 298 K) and is obviously higher than UTSA-72 (35.6), PCN-88 (15.2), and BUT-11 (31.5) at 298 K. Furthermore, other comparisons of selectivity are list in Table S5, .

elements.content: What’s more, to elucidate the reason that NUM-3a exhibits a comparatively high adsorption amount and selectivity for CO2, the structure of NUM-3 is carefully analyzed. In the surface of the cavities of cages A and B, there exist uncoordinated oxygen atoms of carboxyl groups, which can form strong electrostatic interactions with CO2 molecules. The window size of the cages is an important factor that significantly hinders/blocks the gas molecules adsorption and diffusion into the MOF channel. As shown in , along the c axis, the triangular window sizes of cages A, B, C, and D are different, in which the window size of cage D is the smallest (4.0 Å × 4.0 Å × 4.0 Å, getting rid of the van der Waals radius). However, the empirical kinetic diameters of CO2/C2H4/C2H6 are ∼3.3/4.2/4.4 Å, which means that cage D hinders the C2H4 and C2H6 adsorption and diffusion along the c axis. In addition, the significant quadrupole moment of CO2 molecules might induce a stronger interaction with the host framework. In order to further confirm the strong interaction between CO2 and the framework, the adsorption enthalpies (Q st) were calculated by the Virial equation. As shown in Figure S12, , the initial Q st value of NUM-3a is 24.1 kJ/mol for CO2 which is higher than the Q st values of CH4 (19.4 kJ/mol), C2H4 (16.9 kJ/mol), and C2H6 (21.7 kJ/mol). Therefore, the strong interaction and size match between NUM-3a and CO2 determine the fact that NUM-3a owns comparatively high adsorption capacity and selectivity for CO2 molecules.
elements.clean_text: What's more, to elucidate the reason that NUM-3a exhibits a comparatively high adsorption amount and selectivity for CO2, the structure of NUM-3 is carefully analyzed. In the surface of the cavities of cages A and B, there exist uncoordinated oxygen atoms of carboxyl groups, which can form strong electrostatic interactions with CO2 molecules. The window size of the cages is an important factor that significantly hinders/blocks the gas molecules adsorption and diffusion into the MOF channel. As shown in , along the c axis, the triangular window sizes of cages A, B, C, and D are different, in which the window size of cage D is the smallest (4.0 Å × 4.0 Å × 4.0 Å, getting rid of the van der Waals radius). However, the empirical kinetic diameters of CO2/C2H4/C2H6 are ~3.3/4.2/4.4 Å, which means that cage D hinders the C2H4 and C2H6 adsorption and diffusion along the c axis. In addition, the significant quadrupole moment of CO2 molecules might induce a stronger interaction with the host framework. In order to further confirm the strong interaction between CO2 and the framework, the adsorption enthalpies (Q st) were calculated by the Virial equation. As shown in Figure S12, , the initial Q st value of NUM-3a is 24.1 kJ/mol for CO2 which is higher than the Q st values of CH4 (19.4 kJ/mol), C2H4 (16.9 kJ/mol), and C2H6 (21.7 kJ/mol). Therefore, the strong interaction and size match between NUM-3a and CO2 determine the fact that NUM-3a owns comparatively high adsorption capacity and selectivity for CO2 molecules.

elements.content: Triangular window sizes of the cages A, B, C, and D (getting rid of the van der Waals radius).

elements.content: In summary, a multicage-based MOF NUM-3 with new topology has been rationally synthesized with angle-directed and face-directed mixed-ligands strategy. Single crystal structure analysis revealed that there exist four kinds of cages in the framework of NUM-3, and the four kinds of cages in the order ABCDCBA as the minimum repeat unit form a 1D tortuous channel along the c axis. Based on these characteristics, NUM-3a exhibits the capacity of efficient CO2 capture over N2, CH4, C2H4, and C2H6. At 273 K, the adsorption amount can reach 113 cm3 (STP)/g, and the selectivities for CO2/CH4 and CO2/N2 are 11.0 (50/50) and 82.8 (15/85), respectively, which are higher than those for many famous MOFs materials. Therefore, this work might motivate more extensive research to develop new cage-based MOFs using their confinement effect to enhance the capacities to selectively capture specific gas molecules.
elements.clean_text:
Conclusions

In summary, a multicage-based MOF NUM-3 with new topology has been rationally synthesized with angle-directed and face-directed mixed-ligands strategy. Single crystal structure analysis revealed that there exist four kinds of cages in the framework of NUM-3, and the four kinds of cages in the order ABCDCBA as the minimum repeat unit form a 1D tortuous channel along the c axis. Based on these characteristics, NUM-3a exhibits the capacity of efficient CO2 capture over N2, CH4, C2H4, and C2H6. At 273 K, the adsorption amount can reach 113 cm3 (STP)/g, and the selectivities for CO2/CH4 and CO2/N2 are 11.0 (50/50) and 82.8 (15/85), respectively, which are higher than those for many famous MOFs materials. Therefore, this work might motivate more extensive research to develop new cage-based MOFs using their confinement effect to enhance the capacities to selectively capture specific gas molecules.

cln_elements.content: A mixture of Ni­(NO3)2·6H2O (291 mg, 0.1 mmol), tpt (156 mg, 0.05 mmol), and H4abtc (179 mg, 0.05 mmol) was dispersed into 16 mL of mixed solvent (DMF/C2H5OH/H2O, 6/1/1, v/v/v) in a screw-capped glass vial (20 mL). After the mixture was stirred for 10 min, the vial was sealed and placed in a 95 °C oven for 3 days. The kelly block crystals were obtained after cooling to room temperature. The yield was about 80% based on the metal. IR spectrum (cm–1): 3412m, 1660s, 1559w, 1518m, 1434w, 1376s, 1244w, 1097m, 1060w, 807m, 780m, 718m, 655m, 513m. Elem anal. Calcd for NUM-3 (C54H71N13Ni3O27): C, 42.91; H, 4.70; N, 12.05. Found: C, 42.82; H, 4.65; N, 12.20.
cln_elements.clean_text:
Synthese of NUM-3 

A mixture of Ni(NO3)2⋅6H2O (291 mg, 0.1 mmol), tpt (156 mg, 0.05 mmol), and H4abtc (179 mg, 0.05 mmol) was dispersed into 16 mL of mixed solvent (DMF/C2H5OH/H2O, 6/1/1, v/v/v) in a screw-capped glass vial (20 mL). After the mixture was stirred for 10 min, the vial was sealed and placed in a 95 °C oven for 3 days. The kelly block crystals were obtained after cooling to room temperature. The yield was about 80% based on the metal. IR spectrum (cm-1): 3412m, 1660s, 1559w, 1518m, 1434w, 1376s, 1244w, 1097m, 1060w, 807m, 780m, 718m, 655m, 513m. Elem anal. Calcd for NUM-3 (C54H71N13Ni3O27): C, 42.91; H, 4.70; N, 12.05. Found: C, 42.82; H, 4.65; N, 12.20.

cln_elements.content:
According to structural analysis, it further exhibits that, based on organic ligands, using flexibly angle-directed and face-directed self-assembly strategy is easy to form cage-based frameworks. The four kinds of cages also reveal a different void space, for which the large free voids with inner diameter (getting rid of the van der Waals radius) are ∼13.0 Å for cage A, ∼10.0 Å for cage B, ∼7.0 Å for cage C, and ∼4.0 Å for cage D, respectively. PLATON analysis showed that the effective free volume of NUM-3 is 56.6% of the crystal volume (23355.2 Å3 out of the 41249.3 Å3 unit cell volume) without free solvent molecules. Based on these characteristics of the cages, along the c axis, 1D tortuous channels can be viewed (Figure S3, ), in which the most narrow place could control the type of the molecules captured into channels. The structural features are conducive to interact with the suitable gas molecules revealing selective adsorption capacity. In addition, the topological analysis was carried out to obtain insight into the structure of NUM-3. The mononuclear SBU and binuclear SBU could be regarded as 4- and 5-connected nodes, and ligands abtc4– and tpt could be simplified as 4- and 3-connected nodes, respectively. Particularly, as shown in Figure S4, , the ligands abtc4– exhibit two kinds of 4-connected models. Thus, the 3D framework of NUM-3 can be viewed as a (3,4,5)-connected topology with Point (Schlafli) symbol {63}2{64·82}5{66·84}2, importantly, which is a new topology (Figure S4, ).

Stabilities of <bold>NUM-3</bold>

The solvent stability (immersing in a different solvent for more than 3 days) and thermal stability of NUM-3 were demonstrated by PXRD (Figure S5, ) and thermogravimetric (TG) analyses (Figure S8, ). As shown in Figure S5, , NUM-3 exhibits good stability in common solvents, for example, C2H5OH, CH3OH, CH3COCH3, CH2Cl2, and CH3CN, and they still retain a crystalline state under optical microscope (Figure S9, ). The TG curve shows that the thermally stability can reach about 300 °C. Some uncoordinated guest molecules were confirmed by elemental analysis and TGA.

Gas Sorption Properties of <bold>NUM-3a</bold>

To assess the permanent porosity of NUM-3a (activated NUM-3), the N2 adsorption at 77 K was measured, and a fully reversible type I isotherm obtained exhibits a very sharp uptake at P/P 0 < 0.05, which clearly indicated the microporous character (Figure S10, ). The saturation uptake of NUM-3a for nitrogen physisorption is 531.2 cm3/g, and the pore volume is 0.82 cm3/g. According to the N2 adsorption data, the apparent Brunauer–Emmett–Teller (BET) and Langmuir surface areas are 2111.2 and 2307.2 m2/g, respectively, which are located at the middle position among MOFs materials (). The BET surface area of NUM-3a is higher than many reported MOFs, such as MOF-505 (1547 m2/g), Mg-MOF-74 (1495 m2/g), CoMOF-74 (1080 m2/g), and SIFSIX-2-Cu-i (735 m2/g).

Due to its comparatively high surface areas and void volumes and in order to understand the unique pore structure of NUM-3a, the low-pressure sorption isotherms of the pure-components of CO2, CH4, C2H4, C2H6, and N2 were collected at 273 and 298 K, respectively. As shown in a, NUM-3a shows a comparatively high adsorption amount of CO2, in which the largest adsorption amount can reach 113 cm3(STP)/g at 273 K and 1 atm. However, compared with CO2, the uptake amounts of CH4, C2H4, C2H6, and N2 are only 39, 41, 27, and 10 cm3(STP)/g, respectively, which are clearly less than the adsorption amount of CO2. As well as at 273 K, at an ambient temperature of 298 K, NUM-3a exhibits a similar adsorption trend (83 cm3 (STP)/g for CO2, 25 cm3(STP)/g for CH4, 34 cm3(STP)/g for C2H4, 24 cm3(STP)/g for C2H6, and 5 cm3(STP)/g for N2; b). As shown in , the adsorption amount of NUM-3a for CO2 is not the highest, but which is still higher than a lot of well-known MOFs, such as MFM-130 (109 cm3/g at 273 K and 59 cm3/g at 298 K), MAF-23 (74.2 cm3/g at 273 K and 56.1 cm3/g at 298 K), ZIF-69 (70 cm3/g at 273 K), Zn­(ain)2·(DMF) (66.4 cm3/g at 273 K and 51.3 cm3/g at 298 K), and BIF-41 (77.0 cm3/g at 273 K and 63.5 cm3/g at 294 K).

Conclusions

In summary, a multicage-based MOF NUM-3 with new topology has been rationally synthesized with angle-directed and face-directed mixed-ligands strategy. Single crystal structure analysis revealed that there exist four kinds of cages in the framework of NUM-3, and the four kinds of cages in the order ABCDCBA as the minimum repeat unit form a 1D tortuous channel along the c axis. Based on these characteristics, NUM-3a exhibits the capacity of efficient CO2 capture over N2, CH4, C2H4, and C2H6. At 273 K, the adsorption amount can reach 113 cm3 (STP)/g, and the selectivities for CO2/CH4 and CO2/N2 are 11.0 (50/50) and 82.8 (15/85), respectively, which are higher than those for many famous MOFs materials. Therefore, this work might motivate more extensive research to develop new cage-based MOFs using their confinement effect to enhance the capacities to selectively capture specific gas molecules.

According to structural analysis, it further exhibits that, based on organic ligands, using flexibly angle-directed and face-directed self-assembly strategy is easy to form cage-based frameworks. The four kinds of cages also reveal a different void space, for which the large free voids with inner diameter (getting rid of the van der Waals radius) are ~13.0 Å for cage A, ~10.0 Å for cage B, ~7.0 Å for cage C, and ~4.0 Å for cage D, respectively. PLATON analysis showed that the effective free volume of NUM-3 is 56.6% of the crystal volume (23355.2 Å3 out of the 41249.3 Å3 unit cell volume) without free solvent molecules. Based on these characteristics of the cages, along the c axis, 1D tortuous channels can be viewed (Figure S3, ), in which the most narrow place could control the type of the molecules captured into channels. The structural features are conducive to interact with the suitable gas molecules revealing selective adsorption capacity. In addition, the topological analysis was carried out to obtain insight into the structure of NUM-3. The mononuclear SBU and binuclear SBU could be regarded as 4- and 5-connected nodes, and ligands abtc4- and tpt could be simplified as 4- and 3-connected nodes, respectively. Particularly, as shown in Figure S4, , the ligands abtc4- exhibit two kinds of 4-connected models. Thus, the 3D framework of NUM-3 can be viewed as a (3,4,5)-connected topology with Point (Schlafli) symbol {63}2{64⋅82}5{66⋅84}2, importantly, which is a new topology (Figure S4, ).

Stabilities of NUM-3 

The solvent stability (immersing in a different solvent for more than 3 days) and thermal stability of NUM-3 were demonstrated by PXRD (Figure S5, ) and thermogravimetric (TG) analyses (Figure S8, ). As shown in Figure S5, , NUM-3 exhibits good stability in common solvents, for example, C2H5OH, CH3OH, CH3COCH3, CH2Cl2, and CH3CN, and they still retain a crystalline state under optical microscope (Figure S9, ). The TG curve shows that the thermally stability can reach about 300 °C. Some uncoordinated guest molecules were confirmed by elemental analysis and TGA.

Gas Sorption Properties of NUM-3a 

To assess the permanent porosity of NUM-3a (activated NUM-3), the N2 adsorption at 77 K was measured, and a fully reversible type I isotherm obtained exhibits a very sharp uptake at P/P 0 < 0.05, which clearly indicated the microporous character (Figure S10, ). The saturation uptake of NUM-3a for nitrogen physisorption is 531.2 cm3/g, and the pore volume is 0.82 cm3/g. According to the N2 adsorption data, the apparent Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) and Langmuir surface areas are 2111.2 and 2307.2 m2/g, respectively, which are located at the middle position among MOFs materials (). The BET surface area of NUM-3a is higher than many reported MOFs, such as MOF-505 (1547 m2/g), Mg-MOF-74 (1495 m2/g), CoMOF-74 (1080 m2/g), and SIFSIX-2-Cu-i (735 m2/g). 

Due to its comparatively high surface areas and void volumes and in order to understand the unique pore structure of NUM-3a, the low-pressure sorption isotherms of the pure-components of CO2, CH4, C2H4, C2H6, and N2 were collected at 273 and 298 K, respectively. As shown in a, NUM-3a shows a comparatively high adsorption amount of CO2, in which the largest adsorption amount can reach 113 cm3(STP)/g at 273 K and 1 atm. However, compared with CO2, the uptake amounts of CH4, C2H4, C2H6, and N2 are only 39, 41, 27, and 10 cm3(STP)/g, respectively, which are clearly less than the adsorption amount of CO2. As well as at 273 K, at an ambient temperature of 298 K, NUM-3a exhibits a similar adsorption trend (83 cm3 (STP)/g for CO2, 25 cm3(STP)/g for CH4, 34 cm3(STP)/g for C2H4, 24 cm3(STP)/g for C2H6, and 5 cm3(STP)/g for N2; b). As shown in , the adsorption amount of NUM-3a for CO2 is not the highest, but which is still higher than a lot of well-known MOFs, such as MFM-130 (109 cm3/g at 273 K and 59 cm3/g at 298 K), MAF-23 (74.2 cm3/g at 273 K and 56.1 cm3/g at 298 K), ZIF-69 (70 cm3/g at 273 K), Zn(ain)2⋅(DMF) (66.4 cm3/g at 273 K and 51.3 cm3/g at 298 K), and BIF-41 (77.0 cm3/g at 273 K and 63.5 cm3/g at 294 K). 

Conclusions

In summary, a multicage-based MOF NUM-3 with new topology has been rationally synthesized with angle-directed and face-directed mixed-ligands strategy. Single crystal structure analysis revealed that there exist four kinds of cages in the framework of NUM-3, and the four kinds of cages in the order ABCDCBA as the minimum repeat unit form a 1D tortuous channel along the c axis. Based on these characteristics, NUM-3a exhibits the capacity of efficient CO2 capture over N2, CH4, C2H4, and C2H6. At 273 K, the adsorption amount can reach 113 cm3 (STP)/g, and the selectivities for CO2/CH4 and CO2/N2 are 11.0 (50/50) and 82.8 (15/85), respectively, which are higher than those for many famous MOFs materials. Therefore, this work might motivate more extensive research to develop new cage-based MOFs using their confinement effect to enhance the capacities to selectively capture specific gas molecules.

metadata.title:
Construction
of a Multi-Cage-Based MOF with a Unique Network for Efficient CO2 Capture
